WorkItem.Description:
I found this because I noticed my boss armor value was set to 11,000 from an old version instead of 10,643.
 
Steps to recreate:
 - load a cat file
 - go to options tab
 - change boss armor value
 - file save
 - file load the same file
 - it will change back to what it was
 
If you change the armor value then change some gear then save, it saves correctly.  Then you can change the gear back and save.
WorkItem.Summary: [Cat] Boss Armor value does not save correctly

Comments.Message: Valid bug, but just to make sure you know, you probably don't have any reason to change that option, it's obsolete.
Guess I just assume boxes I can type in do something heh... :)

It definitely does something, it just doesn't have a useful use. All bosses in WotLK have the same armor: 10643, so it's only ever valid to leave it at that (default). So about all you can use it for is simulating combat against other players with different armor values.

The only time you would change it is if you need to set the Target Level to something other than 83 (like if you are gearing for Heroics instead of Raids because you are a fresh 80). The non-83 Bosses have different Armor values.
Mine was at 11,000.  I have no idea why as I don't think I've ever changed it before.  Maybe when WotLK first came out that was the default and was saved to my file and thus never changed?
